title: What is the most trusted classical rock song? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Most trusted?” I’m not sure I fully understand the question. I know my personal score card reads something like this: 1- Requires excellent musicianship 2- Smart lyrics 3- Generally makes me want to get and dance/play to it 4- Has a breath taking moment (or two) in it I could make a case for a lot of songs here, but my song is “My Old School” by Steely Dan.

According to my experience, some classics that never fail are Jump (Van Halen), Hotel California (Eagles), Smoke On The Water (Deep Purple), Kashmir (Led Zeppelin), Stairway To Heaven (Led Zeppelin), The Number Of The Beast (Iron Maiden - technically it’s not classic rock, but still a classic), La Grange (ZZ Top) and basically most of AC/DC’s classics… Thunderstruck, Highway To Hell, Back In Black, Whole Lotta Rosie, The Jack, For Those About To Rock… We Salute You, T.N.T….
